page.title: 04Children's Indoor Games
page.content: It is in this field that modern tecnology has really made an impact. 31% of the children surveyed had access to a computer in the home. Adventure games, where the result depends upon the decisions that the children make themselves, Space - Invaders and games based on T.V. or Cinema Films are popular. Videos provide another source of home entertainment. 39% of the survey children had a video in the home. T.V. also sparked off interest in other games. Snooker and table tennis are examples, as is charades, a game of mime, when a team has to guess a title of a book, film or play from the actions of one person. Board games too are still popular. Scrabble, a word game, and Monopoly, a game of buying property, are played by many children.
